subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Cohort Analysis
description: A short lesson to help you apply Cohort Analysis.

hook.text: A startup's total revenue grew 30% last quarter. The CEO celebrated. The data scientist panicked.

buildup.text: Cohort analysis groups users by when they joined, then tracks each group's behavior separately.

discovery.text: The data scientist found that new users spent less each month. Growth was masking a retention crisis.

twist.text: Without cohort analysis, the company would have scaled a broken productâ€”pouring fuel on a sinking ship.

climax.text: They paused marketing, fixed retention, and then scaled. Revenue tripled in six months.

punchline.text: Totals hide the truth. Cohorts reveal it.

quiz.question: What did cohort analysis reveal in the startup's growing revenue?
options: That marketing costs were too high to sustain growth
That new user cohorts were spending less over time, hiding a retention crisis
That the product was being used by fewer but higher-paying customers
